lead_paragraph: Ms. Conway’s criticism of Mitt Romney was expected to draw fury from President-elect Donald J. Trump. But she is not a typical aide.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and MAGGIE HABERMAN

headline.print_headline: Challenging the Boss in Public? For a Trump Aide, That’s Part of the Job
headline.main: Challenging the Boss in Public? For Kellyanne Conway, It’s Part of the Job

snippet: Ms. Conway’s criticism of Mitt Romney was expected to draw fury from President-elect Donald J. Trump. But she is not a typical aide....
abstract: ellyanne Conway, senior adviser to Pres-elect Donald J Trump, proves she is one of very few people who can publicly challenge her boss when she made remarks against former Mass Gov Mitt Romney, who is being considered for role on Trump's cabinet; Conway's comments about Romney, who heavily criticized Trump during presidential campaign, appear to be regarded by Trump as sign of loyalty.
